{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:BrnBld PolarsternSideSketch.svg|360px|RV Polarstern]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country=[[Germany]] |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|Germany|state}} |Ship name=''Polarstern'' |Ship namesake=[[Pole star]] |Ship owner=Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung<ref name=dnv>{{csr|register=DNV|id=G16829|shipname=Polarstern|accessdate=2016-04-11}}</ref> |Ship operator=[[Alfred Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research|Alfred Wegener Institute]] (AWI) |Ship registry=[[Bremerhaven]], {{flag|Germany}} |Ship route=[[Arctic]] and [[Antarctica]] |Ship ordered=28 August 1980<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship builder=[[Howaldtswerke-Deutsche Werft]] at [[Kiel]] and the [[Nobiskrug]] at [[Rendsburg]] |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number=707<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship way number= |Ship laid down=22 September 1981<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship launched=6 January 1982<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship completed=8 December 1982<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship homeport= |Ship christened= |Ship acquired= |Ship maiden voyage= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship identification=*[[Call sign]]: DBLK *{{IMO Number|8013132}} *{{MMSI|211202460}} *{{ship register|DNV|G16829}} |Ship fate= |Ship status=In service |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type=[[Icebreaker]], [[research vessel]] |Ship tonnage={{GT|12,614}}<ref name="dnv" /> |Ship displacement=17,300 [[tonne]]s |Ship length= {{convert|117.91|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|25.07|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught={{convert|11.21|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= |Ship depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship ice class= |Ship sail plan= |Ship power=Four [[diesel engine]]s, {{convert|14,000|kW|hp|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed={{convert|15.5|kn|lk=on}} |Ship capacity=124 persons |Ship crew=44 |Ship notes= }} |} [[research vessel|RV]] '''''Polarstern''''' (meaning [[pole star]]) is a [[Germany|German]] research [[icebreaker]] of the [[Alfred Wegener Institute for Polar and Marine Research]] (AWI) in [[Bremerhaven]]. ''Polarstern'' was commissioned in 1982 and is mainly used for research in the [[Arctic]] and [[Antarctica]]. It is planned that she will be replaced by ''Polarstern II'' around the year 2020,<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.bmbf.de/de/ausschreibung-nachfolgebau-polarstern-2453.html|title=Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung |access-date=2017-07-18}}</ref> after it was decided that the [[Aurora Borealis (icebreaker)|European Research Icebreaker ''Aurora Borealis'']] will not be built in her original form.
''Polarstern'' was built by [[Howaldtswerke-Deutsche Werft]] in [[Kiel]] and [[Nobiskrug]] in [[Rendsburg]]. The ship has a length of 118 metres (387 feet) and is a [[double hull|double-hulled]] icebreaker. She is operational at temperatures as low as -50°C. (-58°F) ''Polarstern'' can break through ice {{convert|1.5|m|abbr=on}} thick at a speed of 5 [[knot (unit)|knots]]. Thicker ice up to {{convert|3|m|abbr=on}} thick can be broken by ramming.
==History== On 7 September 1991, ''Polarstern'', assisted by the [[Sweden|Swedish]] arctic [[icebreaker]] ''[[Oden (1988 icebreaker)|Oden]]'' reached the [[North Pole]] as the first conventional powered vessels.<ref>Fütterer, D. et al. (1992) The Expedition ARK-VIII/3 of RV Polarstern in 1991, Reports on Polar and Marine Research, Bremerhaven, '''107''', 267 pp, [https://dx.doi.org/10013/epic.10107.d001 hdl:10013/epic.10107.d001] (pdf 6.4 MB)</ref> Both scientific parties and crew took oceanographic and geological samples and had a common [[tug of war]] and a [[association football|football]] game on an ice floe. ''Polarstern'' again reached the pole exactly 10 years later<ref>Thiede, J. et al. (2002) POLARSTERN ARKTIS XVII/2 Cruise Report: AMORE 2001 (Arctic Mid-Ocean Ridge Expedition), Reports on Polar and Marine Research, Bremerhaven, '''421''', 390 pp, [https://dx.doi.org/10013/epic.10107.d001 hdl:10013/epic.10426.d001] (pdf 8 MB)</ref> together with the [[USCGC Healy|USCGC ''Healy'']]. She returned for a third time on 22 August 22 2011 at exactly 9.42 a.m. This time she reported the most frequently recurring ice thickness at 0.9 m compared with 2 m in 2001, which corresponds to the long-term average.<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.research-in-germany.de/74228/2011-08-24-research-vessel-polarstern-at-north-pole.html |title=Research Vessel Polarstern at North Pole |date=August 24, 2011 |accessdate=September 12, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130212052710/http://www.research-in-germany.de/74228/2011-08-24-research-vessel-polarstern-at-north-pole.html |archivedate=February 12, 2013 |df= }} </ref>
On March 2, 2008, one of the vessel's helicopters crashed on a routine flight to the Antarctic [[Neumayer Station|Neumayer II]] base. The German pilot and a Dutch researcher were killed, three other passengers were injured.<ref> {{cite web |title = awi.de - sad times (ANT-XXIV/3 Weekly report No. 3) |url = http://www.awi.de/en/infrastructure/ships/polarstern/weekly_reports/all_expeditions/ant_xxiv/ant_xxiv3/9_march_2008/ |accessdate = 2008-03-30 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20091117161741/http://www.awi.de/en/infrastructure/ships/polarstern/weekly_reports/all_expeditions/ant_xxiv/ant_xxiv3/9_march_2008/ |archivedate = 2009-11-17 |df = }} </ref><ref> {{cite web |title = Pooljaar.nl - The crash in retrospect (article in Dutch) |url = http://pooljaar.nl/ijzer/2008/03/13/terugblik-op-de-crash/ |accessdate = 2008-03-28 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110724163125/http://pooljaar.nl/ijzer/2008/03/13/terugblik-op-de-crash/ |archivedate = 2011-07-24 |df = }} </ref>
On October 17, 2008, ''Polarstern'' was the first [[research ship]] to ever travel through both the [[Northeast Passage]] and the [[Northwest Passage]] in one cruise, thus circumnavigating the North Pole.<ref> {{cite web |title=idw-online.de - Research around the North Pole |url=http://idw-online.de/pages/de/news284090 |accessdate=2008-10-20}} </ref>
[[Image:Polarstern.gif|thumb|right|''Polarstern'' breaking ice]] [[Image:Polarstern awi hg.jpg|thumb|right|''Polarstern'']] [[File:Polarstern library hg.jpg|thumb|right|Library in the blue saloon]]
==Expeditions== Current listings of all cruises on board ''Polarstern'' as well as associated content (e.g., tracklines, weekly reports, cruise reports, publications and data) are presented in [http://expedition.awi.de AWI's research platform portal].
==In popular culture== Polarstern is also the name of the first track of [[Eisbrecher|Eisbrecher's]] ([[German language|German]] for ''Icebreaker'') first album, ''[[Eisbrecher (Eisbrecher album)|Eisbrecher]]''. Throughout the track in Russian, French and only then in German, narrations are given specifying the dimensions and specifications of an enormous ship, blowing the measurements of the real icebreaker out of proportion (e.g.: length of 236 metres). This way the artist may probably want to reference the international matter of Arctic, the untouchable dominance of Soviet technology pioneers in nuclear-powered icebreakers, and to give the tribute to Russian Arctic researches: Fabian Gottlieb Thaddeus von Bellingshausen, Ferdinand Friedrich Georg Ludwig von Wrangelll, Georgy Alexeyevich Ushakov, Otto Yulyevich Schmidt and Ivan Dmitrievich Papanin.
The ship plays a central role in German musician [[Schiller (band)|Schiller's]] 2010 album ''[[Atemlos (Schiller album)|Atemlos]]''. A track is titled after the ship. It is also featured in the DVD of the same title, showing the musician's expedition on the vessel.
==References== {{Reflist}}
== External links == {{Commons category|Polarstern_(ship,_1982)|PFS Polarstern}} * {{Official website|http://www.awi.de/de/infrastruktur/schiffe/polarstern/ }} * [http://www.awi.de/fileadmin/user_upload/MET/PolarsternCoursePlot/psobse.png Current position of ''Polarstern''] * [https://www.pangaea.de/expeditions/cr.php/Polarstern List of all cruises with links to cruise reports and data] * [https://www.theguardian.com/frontpage/story/0,,1969310,00.html Secrets of the seas: Jurassic shrimp, hairy crabs and giant microbes], news article featuring The ''Polarstern''

{{for|the train station in Nashville, Tennessee|Riverfront Station}} [[File:View of Sabarmati Riverfront, Ahmedabad.jpg|thumb|right|View of Sabarmati Riverfront in [[Ahmedabad]], May 2012]] A '''riverfront''' is a region along a river; often in larger cities that border a river, the riverfront will be lined with [[marina]]s, [[Dock (maritime)|dock]]s, [[park]]s, [[tree]]s, or minor attractions. Today many riverfronts are a staple of [[modernism]] and city [[beautification]].

[[File:Parco delle serre rci v2012 1 mappa.jpg|thumb|right|Park map]] [[Image:Il Fallà. Sullo sfondo le montagne delle Serre con il Monte Cucco.jpg|thumb|right|The Serre from Fallà.]] [[Image:Cascata Marmarico.JPG|thumb|right|[[Cascata del Marmarico]].]] The '''Serre Calabresi''' or ''Calabrian Serre'' ([[Calabrian languages|Calabrian]] dialect: ''Serra'') are a mountain and hill area of [[Calabria]], southern [[Italy]], characterized by large extents of woods.
The name could be derived by the Jewish ''Ser'', meaning "mountains", or it could refer to the shape of a handsaw. The highest peak is the [[Monte Pecoraro]], with an altitude of 1423 m.
==Geography and geology==
The chain begins at the [[Passo della Limina]] and ends at [[Catanzaro Isthm]], the narrowest in Italy (35 km separating the [[Ionian Sea]] from the [[Tyrrhenian Sea]]). It is bounded by the [[Sila Range]] from the north and by the [[Aspromonte]] from the south.
Geologically, the Serre Calabresi are part of the so-called [[Calabrian Alps]], and are mostly formed by [[graniti]], [[porphyry (geology)|porphyry]] and [[diorite]]. The eastern area also includes [[sandstone]], while the [[Monte Mammicomito]] has instead a [[limestone]]-[[dolomite]] structure, characterized also by [[Karst topography]]. [[Badlands]] are also present.
==Fauna and vegetation== The fauna of the Serre has been depleted by human hunting. Recently, the [[Italian wolf]] has returned, probably from Sila.
Vegetation include ''[[Abies alba]]'' and [[Oak]] in the lowest slopes, while the [[Beech]] predominates over the 80 m of altitude.
==Sources == *{{cite book|title=Il Parco delle Serre (Guida naturalistica ed escursionisitica) |first=Francesco |last=Bevilacqua |publisher=Rubbettino Editore}} == See also ==
*[[Natural regional park of Serre]]
== External links ==
